iplat.title: IPlat - My First Video Game
iplat.description: Short 2D platform game developed in 1 week with the Löve2D framework.

context.title: Context
context.paragraph1: IPlat is the first game I created in 9th grade. It is a quite simple 2D platform.
context.paragraph2: The player aims to move forward on each screen until the end of the game.
context.paragraph3: Obtaining coins add one more health point.
context.paragraph4: When the player no longer has health points they are teleported to the beginning of the current screen.
context.problemText: How to create a short 2D platformer without knowledge in less than a week ?

objectives.title: Objectives
objectives.item1: Discover and master the basics of the Löve2D framework
objectives.item3: Understanding the fundamental mechanics of a platform game (physics, collisions, inputs)
objectives.item4: Deliver a playable and functional game within a short period
objectives.item5: Publish my first game on a distribution platform (Itch.io)

missions.title: Main Tasks
missions.item2: Development of the physics engine and collisions

academic.title: Academic Incomes
academic.intro: Although realized outside the academic framework, this project has enabled me to acquire essential skills that have been useful to me in my training in Computer Science:
academic.projectManagementText: Organization of work and respect of deadlines

conclusion.title: Conclusion and Learning
conclusion.paragraph1: IPlat was a success for what I was able to learn during the creation, but from a different point of view. the game is quite short, and uses that assets found on the Internet, so I could have done better.
conclusion.paragraph2: This project reinforced my passion for developing video games and gave me the desire to continue creating and learning.
